areaDescription: The Thornwood Wilds writhe with predatory intelligence, their canopy of clawed branches seeming to shift and close behind intruders. Ancient trees lean inward like conspirators, their moss-choked bark weeping strange saps while root-latticed shadows conceal signs of recent violence. The air tastes of copper and fear, thick with the scent of spilled blood and the acrid smoke of bandit camps. Every snapping twig and rustling leaf might herald ambush, while drag marks in the earth tell grim stories of those who ventured here before you.

locations.name: Ambush Site
locations.description: A blood-stained clearing where the aftermath of a brutal bandit ambush tells its grim story. Overturned merchant wagons leak scattered goods among the brambles, while the fallen body of Ranger Corwin lies motionless near a shattered shield, victim of the vicious attack. Fresh drag marks and bloodied cloth fragments lead north through the undergrowth, suggesting any survivors may have fled in that direction. The metallic scent of recent violence and death hangs heavy in the still air.
lootTable: Scattered merchant goods from the attacked caravan
Broken bandit weapon with distinctive markings
Trail rations and medical supplies from overturned wagon
plotHooks: The wounded scout witnessed bandits taking captives to Malarok's camp in the old watchtower
Bandit equipment shows signs of magical enhancement, suggesting Malarok's influence
Fresh tracks lead toward the crumbling watchtower where Malarok has established his base
The scout mentions seeing dark energy and hearing the sorcerer's voice commanding the bandits
locations.dmInstructions: This location serves as the entry point into the Thornwood investigation. The wounded scout provides crucial intelligence about Malarok's operations and the location of his watchtower base. Use this to drive the party toward the sorcerer's stronghold.
dcChecks: Medicine DC 12: Treat the wounded scout's injuries effectively
Investigation DC 11: Study the ambush site to find evidence of Malarok's magical corruption affecting the bandits
Survival DC 13: Follow the tracks leading toward Malarok's watchtower stronghold
locations.accessibility: Forest clearing accessible from main trade road

features.name: Overturned Wagon
features.description: A merchant wagon lying on its side, contents scattered and searched by the bandits during their raid.

features.name: Battle Traces
features.description: Blood stains, weapon marks on trees, and disturbed earth showing the fierce struggle that took place here.

features.name: Drag Marks
features.description: Clear signs where captives and valuable goods were dragged north through the forest, suggesting survivors fled toward the Wolf's Den Cave.

features.name: Fallen Ranger
features.description: The body of Ranger Corwin lies near a shattered shield, a victim of the brutal bandit ambush. His ranger's cloak is torn and bloodied.

locations.name: Bandit Trail
locations.description: A narrow path winding through dense thornbushes shows signs of frequent use by the bandit gang. Boot prints mix with drag marks in the muddy earth, while broken branches and disturbed undergrowth reveal the route to their hidden stronghold. Crude warning markers hang from twisted trees, meant to deter casual travelers.
locations.dmInstructions: This trail leads toward the bandit stronghold. Consider having the party encounter bandit patrols or traps along the way. Use this location to build tension as they get closer to the main threat.

traps.name: Concealed Rope Snare
traps.description: A hidden rope trap designed to catch pursuing rangers by the ankle.
traps.effect: Restrains target, requires DC 15 Athletics or Acrobatics to escape

dcChecks: Stealth DC 13: Move quietly to avoid alerting bandit patrols ahead
Survival DC 11: Follow the bandit trail without losing the path
Perception DC 12: Notice warning markers and potential ambush points
locations.accessibility: Narrow forest path requiring careful navigation

features.name: Warning Totems
features.description: Crude carved symbols hung from branches, meant to intimidate and warn off casual travelers.

features.name: Tracking Signs
features.description: Boot prints, broken vegetation, and drag marks showing frequent bandit movement toward their stronghold.

locations.name: Abandoned Camp
locations.description: A small clearing hidden within thorny undergrowth that once served as a temporary holding area for bandit captives. Empty cages and discarded rope show this camp was recently abandoned, with prisoners moved to other locations deeper in the forest.
lootTable: Torn map showing bandit patrol routes
Abandoned prisoner belongings with clues to other captives
plotHooks: Evidence suggests captives were recently moved to other locations
Other prisoners were taken deeper into the forest toward a permanent base
The abandoned camp shows signs of hasty evacuation
Scattered belongings hint at the fate of missing travelers
locations.dmInstructions: This abandoned camp shows evidence of the bandits' operations and recent evacuation. Use this location to build tension and direct the party toward active locations where they can find NPCs and engage with the plot.
dcChecks: Investigation DC 10: Study the abandoned captive area for clues about other prisoners
Survival DC 11: Determine how recently the camp was evacuated
Investigation DC 12: Find evidence of where the captives were moved
locations.accessibility: Hidden clearing accessible through dense undergrowth

features.name: Makeshift Cages
features.description: Crude wooden and rope cages used to hold captives, now empty but showing signs of recent use.

features.name: Prisoner Belongings
features.description: Scattered personal effects from captured merchants and travelers, some bearing identifying marks.

features.name: Hidden Cache
features.description: A concealed supply stash containing prisoner rations and basic medical supplies.

locations.name: Hermit's Refuge
locations.description: Ancient trees form a natural sanctuary where Spirit-Touched Hermit Maelo tends to wounded forest creatures. The air shimmers with faint magical energy, and strange symbols carved into bark seem to ward off the corruption spreading from the north. Wildlife that fled the supernatural disturbances finds temporary safety here.

npcs.name: Spirit-Touched Hermit Maelo
npcs.description: An elderly human druid with eyes that reflect otherworldly knowledge and hands that glow faintly with natural magic. Maelo has sensed the supernatural corruption spreading from the northern reaches and understands the connection between the bandits and the dark forces backing them.
npcs.attitude: Mystical and cryptic but ultimately helpful. Concerned about the spreading corruption and willing to aid those who would fight against unnatural influences.

monsters: 1 Tainted Naiad (appears after Maelo's ritual, can be freed with Remove Curse/Lesser Restoration or DC 15 Persuasion + offering purified water)
lootTable: Herbal healing potion brewed by the hermit
Ward stones that protect against supernatural influence
Ancient tome describing the corruption from the north
plotHooks: Maelo explains the supernatural corruption spreading from the Northern Reaches
The hermit offers protection charms against the dark forces backing the bandits
Ancient knowledge about how to cleanse the corruption affecting the region
Warnings about what the party will face in the corrupted northern woods
locations.dmInstructions: Maelo provides mystical insight and preparation for the supernatural threats ahead. He can offer healing, protection, and crucial information about the corruption in the Northern Reaches. After completing his scrying ritual at the spring, a Tainted Naiad emerges - the corrupted former guardian. She attacks initially but can be freed rather than killed through Remove Curse, Lesser Restoration, or peaceful persuasion with an offering of purified spring water (DC 15).
dcChecks: Arcana DC 13: Understand the nature of the supernatural corruption Maelo describes
Religion DC 11: Recognize the protective symbols carved into the sanctuary trees
Nature DC 12: Learn how to identify and resist the spreading corruption
locations.accessibility: Sacred grove protected by natural and magical barriers

features.name: Sacred Grove
features.description: Ancient trees arranged in a natural circle, their bark carved with protective symbols that ward off corruption.

features.name: Healing Springs
features.description: A small spring with pure water that glows faintly with restorative magic, providing sanctuary to injured creatures. Once corrupted by Malarok's influence, now cleansed and protected by the hermit's ritual work.

features.name: Ward Stones
features.description: Standing stones inscribed with druidic runes that create a barrier against supernatural corruption and evil influences.

locations.name: Bandit Stronghold
locations.description: A fortified clearing hidden deep within the thornwood where the bandit gang has established their main base of operations. Crude wooden palisades reinforced with stolen iron create defensive walls, while lookout posts built into ancient oak trees provide commanding views of the approaches. The air carries the scent of wood smoke, unwashed bodies, and something darker - an unnatural corruption that seems to emanate from supplies marked with strange symbols.

npcs.name: Bandit Captain Gorvek
npcs.description: A scarred half-orc warrior who leads the bandit gang with brutal efficiency. His armor bears strange symbols that match those found on the corrupted supplies, and his eyes occasionally flash with an unnatural green light that hints at supernatural influence.
npcs.attitude: Aggressive and paranoid, suspicious of anyone approaching the stronghold. Will fight to defend the base but may attempt to flee if severely outmatched.

monsters: 3 Bandit Warriors (human bandits with scimitars and shields)
1 Bandit Captain Gorvek (half-orc with supernatural backing)
lootTable: Chest containing stolen merchant goods worth 150 gold pieces
Cache of weapons and armor taken from defeated travelers
Mysterious supplies marked with corruption symbols
Map showing planned attacks on trade routes
plotHooks: Strange supplies suggest the bandits are backed by supernatural forces from the north
Captured documents reveal plans for a major assault on the Rangers' Outpost
The corruption affecting Captain Gorvek hints at the larger threat in the Northern Woods
Evidence of communication with mysterious benefactors providing gold and equipment
locations.dmInstructions: This is the climactic encounter for the Thornwood Wilds area. The bandits will fight defensively from their fortifications. Captain Gorvek's corruption connects to the Northern Corrupted Woods storyline. Consider having him flee toward the north if the battle goes poorly, leading the party toward the final area.

doors.name: Palisade Gate
doors.description: A reinforced wooden gate with iron bands, secured with heavy crossbeams.

traps.name: Concealed Pit Trap
traps.description: A camouflaged pit filled with sharpened stakes, positioned to catch attackers approaching the main gate.
traps.effect: 2d6 piercing damage and prone condition, DC 13 Dexterity saving throw for half damage

dcChecks: Stealth DC 14: Approach the stronghold without alerting the sentries
Investigation DC 12: Study the fortifications to identify weak points in the defenses
Perception DC 13: Notice the supernatural corruption affecting the bandit captain
locations.accessibility: Fortified clearing with defensive walls and elevated positions

features.name: Wooden Palisade
features.description: Crude but effective defensive walls made from sharpened logs, reinforced with scavenged iron bands.

features.name: Lookout Posts
features.description: Elevated platforms built into large trees, providing commanding views and defensive positions for the bandits.

features.name: Corrupted Supply Cache
features.description: A collection of supplies marked with strange symbols that emanate an unsettling aura, suggesting supernatural backing.

features.name: Central Fire Pit
features.description: A large fire pit surrounded by crude benches where the bandits gather, cook, and plan their raids.

locations.name: Wolf's Den Cave (Rescue the Lost - SQ004)
locations.description: A narrow cave mouth, partially obscured by thorny bushes, leads into darkness. The sounds of snarling wolves and the desperate clang of steel echo from within. Inside, Wounded Ranger Gareth and Merchant Kael are cornered, making a desperate stand against several unnaturally aggressive wolves corrupted by Malarok's influence.

npcs.name: Wounded Ranger Gareth
npcs.description: A grizzled ranger who was scouting bandit movements when he and Kael were cornered by corrupted wolves. He has a bleeding shoulder wound but fights with grim determination. He carries a partially completed map of the bandit camp's defenses and patrol routes.
npcs.attitude: Stoic and battle-hardened, but grateful for rescue. Eager to share intelligence to stop the bandit threat.

npcs.name: Merchant Kael
npcs.description: A traveling spice trader who was captured during a bandit raid but escaped with Gareth's help. Though shaken, he's surprisingly observant and overheard the bandits discussing their master's ritual plans at an ancient altar site.
npcs.attitude: Nervous but determined to help. Will provide valuable information about bandit operations and ritual preparations.

lootTable: Partial map of bandit patrols (Gareth's intelligence)
Pouch with 20 gold pieces (Kael's emergency funds)
Healer's kit dropped by fleeing bandits
Evidence of Malarok's corruption affecting local wildlife
plotHooks: The survivors reveal they were being held as captives for a terrible sacrifice ritual
Gareth's map can help bypass sentries at the bandit stronghold
Kael's information points directly to Malarok's ritual site and ultimate plan
Both NPCs can serve as guides to help the party navigate the Thornwood
Their rescue provides significant advantages for tackling Malarok's forces
With the wolves defeated, the survivors can return safely to the command post on their own if the party continues forward
locations.dmInstructions: This location resolves the 'Rescue the Lost' (SQ004) side quest. The party's arrival turns the tide of the fight against the corrupted wolves. After the wolves are defeated, the survivors reveal they were being held captive and were intended to be part of a terrible sacrifice ritual. Rescuing both NPCs provides significant tactical advantages and crucial plot information for the final confrontation with Malarok. The survivors can either be escorted back to the Rangers' Command Post for safety, or if the party chooses to push forward, Gareth and Kael are now confident enough to return on their own since the wolves are dead.
dcChecks: Medicine DC 12: Treat Gareth's wound effectively and restore his mobility
Investigation DC 11: Study the corrupted wolves to understand Malarok's influence on wildlife
Survival DC 10: Use Gareth's map to identify the best approach to the bandit stronghold
locations.accessibility: Hidden cave entrance accessible through dense undergrowth from the shrine area

features.name: Makeshift Barricade
features.description: Gareth and Kael have piled rocks and debris at the cave entrance to slow the corrupted wolves.

features.name: Scattered Supplies
features.description: A dropped backpack contains some rations, a water skin, and Kael's emergency coin purse.

features.name: Corruption Signs
features.description: The wolves show visible signs of Malarok's influence - glowing eyes and unnatural aggression.

randomEncounters.description: 1-2 wolves showing signs of Malarok's corruption, with glowing eyes and aggressive behavior
2 bandit scouts on patrol, may flee to warn the main camp if not stopped quickly
A territorial dire boar protecting its young, made more aggressive by the spreading corruption
2-3 twig blights animated by the dark magic seeping from the north
A frightened merchant who escaped a bandit attack, can provide information about recent raids
3-4 bandits lying in wait along the trail, using the dense undergrowth for cover
Animated thornbushes reach out with grasping vines, a manifestation of the forest's corruption
A once-majestic deer with antlers dripping dark ichor, eyes glowing with malevolent intelligence
2 rangers from the outpost searching for their missing scout, can share information about recent sightings
A young treant twisted by Malarok's influence, attacks with whipping branches and thrown rocks

notes: Consider lighting sources and trap placement. Underground areas may have limited resources.
